title: Avocado Puree Recipe for Babies ( Mashed Avocado )
content: Avocado is a great first food for babies. You can start feeding it as soon as your baby starts their solids. Since it is easy to digest, they are great weaning food. Avocado is rich in omega 3 which helps in brain development in babies. You can add some banana to this puree, it adds potassium too

title: Sooji Potato Pancakes Recipe, Finger Food Recipes for Toddlers and Babies
content: This is one recipe that I came up with when I wanted to feed my little one with some snacks in the evening. I had a boiled potato on hand, so I added some sooji and made it into the pancake. It turned out so soft, so it will be easy for your little one to chew. Plus it is so tasty.

content:

title: Banana Oatmeal Recipe for Breakfast, Caramelized Banana Oats Recipe
content:
Recently I have been having oatmeal in my breakfast a lot. I try to add some fruits into the oatmeal and make it more tasty and enjoyable. This is one recipe that I made yesterday and loved it, so with no more delay I am sharing it.

title: Baked Potato Fries Recipe for Kids and Toddler
content:
Most of the kids love french fries, maha is no exception. She loves it so much. But since it is deep fried I kind of stay away from it, finally I made this baked version. It is so easy to make and turns out crunchy too.

title: Babies Curd Rice Recipe - Yogurt Rice Recipe for Kids And Babies
content:
The key to making a tasty and kids friendly curd rice or yogurt rice is to add less yogurt and more milk which makes it tastier.
So give this a try and let me know how it turns out for you.

title: Healthy Vegetable Stir Fry Recipe for Kids and Toddlers
content: This is a great dish to include veggies in your little one's diet. You can add whatever veggies you like in this. The addition of nuts powder in this makes it more tasty and healthy for your kids. You can serve this with rice or use it as a filling in paratha or use it as a filling for roti rolls

title: Instant Wheat Cerelac Recipe for Babies, Travel Food for Babies
content: These powders are great to have handy when traveling since they require no cooking you can just add some milk or water and feed your baby. I am sure you will be feeling so happy when you feed your baby with these instead of the packaged stuff. I will try to share many more recipes similar to this
